snippet: The police said Sunday they had shot a suspect who killed a man at a free-speech event in Copenhagen and another man outside a synagogue.
abstract: Police in Copenhagen shoot and kill man believed to be behind two separate shooting attacks at cafe and synagogue that left two people dead; violence comes amid increasingly anxious atmosphere in Europe, and gives rise to flood of anti-Muslim indictments on Twitter despite fact shooter's motive remains unclear; some suspect Swedish cartoonist Lars Vilks, who is under police protection, may have been target of cafe attack.

byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The police said Sunday they had shot a suspect who killed a man at a free-speech event in Copenhagen and another man outside a synagogue.

headline.main: Gunman Believed to Be Behind 2 Copenhagen Attacks Is Fatally Shot, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Denmark Shaken as Two Attacks Leave Two Dead
